questions.article:
The following text is adapted from Yone Noguchi's 1914 memoir The Story of Yone Noguchi. Noguchi is returning home after eleven years abroad.

I reached Tsushima, my native town, at evening.

I frightened my old father at the station, who was actually trying to find me among some other people. There is no wonder that he could not recognise me; I must have changed a great deal.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does the word "find" most nearly mean?

options.name: A
options.content: Locate

options.name: B
options.content: Reveal

options.name: C
options.content: Persuade

options.name: D
options.content: Embarrass

questions.correct: Locate

questions.article: The ______ Keshni Kashyap's book Tina's Mouth has been very positive. Many reviewers have praised the book, and it won the Asian/Pacific American Award for Literature.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: inspiration for

options.name: B
options.content: reception of

options.name: C
options.content: neglect of

options.name: D
options.content: confusion about

questions.correct: reception of

questions.article: Some social scientists argue that while a belief in the importance of reason and progress is key to democracy, the public's understanding of history is also central to its subsequent comprehension of a state's politics, and if an electorate is to function, historical issues cannot remain the dominion only of academics. History is too ______ to leave to historians alone.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: respectable

options.name: B
options.content: complex

options.name: C
options.content: accessible

options.name: D
options.content: critical

questions.correct: critical

questions.article: A speaker at a recent children's book publishing conference noted that, while many illustrators do excellent work, in her mind, no one has ever ______ Jerry Pinkney's work as the illustrator of The Talking Eggs: A Folktale from the American South: there is no better example of the form, according to the speaker.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: cited

options.name: B
options.content: eclipsed

options.name: C
options.content: augmented

options.name: D
options.content: convened

questions.correct: eclipsed

questions.article: The Village Politicians, painted in the realist style by Wilhelm Leibl, depicts a group of peasants clustered together in conversation and emphasizes accuracy in its portrayal of the experiences of ordinary working people. This style largely ______ the conventions of the romantic style evident in many paintings by Thomas Couture, which instead accentuated their subjects' positive traits by, for example, placing them in staged settings with expensive looking decorations and presenting them with smooth, unblemished skin.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: rejected

options.name: B
options.content: imitated

options.name: C
options.content: epitomized

options.name: D
options.content: extended

questions.correct: rejected

questions.article: In the early days of television in the 1940s, many people thought that US television programs would rely on the financial support of ad agencies and commercial sponsors, much like radio did. But advertisers hesitated to jump into a new space, particularly at a time when the manufacturing of new television sets was stalled due to the US's involvement in World War II. Broadcasters, like the National Broadcasting Company (NBC), needed to persuade advertisers to support their programming despite not knowing whether there would be a robust television audience to begin with.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined phrase in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It describes how broadcasters attempted to convince advertisers to support television.

options.name: B
options.content: It explains why a type of television programming was popular at the time.

options.name: C
options.content: It identifies a specific reason behind some advertisers' hesitance to support television.

options.name: D
options.content: It compares the beginnings of radio programming with the beginnings of television programming in the United States.

questions.correct: It identifies a specific reason behind some advertisers' hesitance to support television.

questions.article: Mountain summits are often described in terms of their elevation, or height above sea level. But a summit's elevation may not be as good an indication of how high the mountain appears to observers as is the summit's prominence, or its height above its surroundings, and these values can differ significantly. For example, the Indian mountain of ______
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses data from the table to complete the example?

options.name: A
options.content: Saser Kangri III has an elevation of 7,495 meters but a considerably lower prominence of 850 meters.

options.name: B
options.content: Kangto has a much higher prominence than does Langpo.

options.name: C
options.content: Kangto has a high prominence but is from a different mountain range than Mount Lakshmi, which has a lower prominence.

options.name: D
options.content: Sri Kailash has an elevation of 6,932 meters and is considered the highest mountain from the Garhwal Himalaya range.

questions.correct: Saser Kangri III has an elevation of 7,495 meters but a considerably lower prominence of 850 meters.

questions.article: Dubautia raillardioides is a species in a family of plants known collectively as the silversword alliance, all of which grow only on the Hawaiian Islands. Members of this alliance exhibit an extraordinary range of phenotypes, with some species maturing into vines and others into shrubs and trees. All species in the alliance descended from a single ancestral tarweed plant that arrived on the islands around 5 million years ago. The tarweed's descendants diversified into distinct species as they adapted to live in the wide variety of habitats found on the Hawaiian Islands.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined phrase in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It lists species from a family of plants found only on the Hawaiian Islands.

options.name: B
options.content: It explains why Dubautia raillardioides is unique among members of the silversword alliance.

options.name: C
options.content: It supplies the name used to refer to a group of related plant species.

options.name: D
options.content: It provides the common name for the Dubautia raillardioides plant.

questions.correct: It supplies the name used to refer to a group of related plant species.

questions.article: Mexican textile artist Victoria Villasana weaves stories of triumph, using her unique method of applying colorful yarn to photographs of people. In some works, Villasana focuses on celebrating cultural icons who are people of color, as she does in her depiction of artist Frida Kahlo. However, in other works, Villasana honors ordinary people, as she does in her captivating portrayal of a woman holding a baby. Villasana sees both of these approaches as ways of depicting power and interconnectedness of all people.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Villasana's works focus on recognizing both famous and everyday examples of human strength and connection.

options.name: B
options.content: Villasana began her artistic career by painting portraits of famous people and then transitioned to depicting everyday people instead.

options.name: C
options.content: Villasana's portrayal of a woman holding a baby focuses more on human connection than it does on human resilience.

options.name: D
options.content: Villasana's depiction of Frida Kahlo receives more attention from scholars than her depiction of a woman holding a baby does.

questions.correct: Villasana's works focus on recognizing both famous and everyday examples of human strength and connection.

questions.article: Community science involves professional scientists collaborating with members of the public to study a topic. This approach to research can promote community engagement by offering insight into the daily life of a scientist. It's also very effective because it greatly increases the amount of data that can be collected, such as when biologist Abbigail Merrill and colleagues studied butterfly size and its relation to behavior and used findings reported by hundreds of students and community members in northwestern Arkansas.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Abbigail Merrill and colleagues used a community science approach in their butterfly research and were surprised at the effect this had on public understanding of the nature of scientists' work.

options.name: B
options.content: A community science approach can increase public understanding of the nature of scientists' work and generate large amounts of data, benefiting both communities and researchers.

options.name: C
options.content: A community science approach can benefit communities by increasing public understanding of the nature of scientists' work, but it's less likely to help researchers obtain accurate data.

options.name: D
options.content: A community science approach allows researchers to collect significantly more data even though it's unlikely to have much of an effect on public understanding of the nature of scientists' work.

questions.correct: A community science approach can increase public understanding of the nature of scientists' work and generate large amounts of data, benefiting both communities and researchers.

questions.article: Biologists Christina Zdenek, Damian Candusso, and their team exposed various snakes to airborne sound and recorded whether they moved toward or away from the sound. The table shows the results for three of the snakes observed in the study. Based on the table, a student concludes that Glory and Boss behaved similarly in the sound trials.
questions.question: Which choice best describes data from the table that support the student's conclusion?

options.name: A
options.content: Boss moved toward the sound, while Bitey Boy moved away from it.

options.name: B
options.content: Bitey Boy and Glory both moved toward the sound.

options.name: C
options.content: Glory and Boss both moved away from the sound.

options.name: D
options.content: Boss moved toward the sound, while Glory moved away from it.

questions.correct: Glory and Boss both moved away from the sound.

questions.article: Among the most visited art museums in the world, the Museo Reina Sofia in Madrid had approximately 4.4 million visitors in 2019. The Museo Reina Sofia also offers virtual tours that art lovers can view online for free. Although there were initial concerns that people who viewed the virtual tours would then consider an in-person visit unnecessary, museum administrators claim that their surveys of in person visitors show that those concerns were unjustified.
questions.question: Which statement, if true, would most directly support the administrators' claim?

options.name: A
options.content: Most surveyed visitors to the Museo Reina Sofia indicated that they lived somewhere other than Madrid.

options.name: B
options.content: Many surveyed visitors to the Museo Reina Sofia indicated that the virtual tours convinced them to plan an in person visit.

options.name: C
options.content: Many surveyed visitors to the Museo Reina Sofia indicated that they would likely view the virtual tours in order to reminisce about their in-person visit.

options.name: D
options.content: Most surveyed visitors to the Museo Reina Sofia indicated that they were unaware of the virtual tours before their first in-person visit.

questions.correct: Many surveyed visitors to the Museo Reina Sofia indicated that the virtual tours convinced them to plan an in person visit.

questions.article: The Clouds is a 423 BCE play by Aristophanes, originally written in ancient Greek. At the time, professional intellectuals called sophists taught customers rhetorical techniques to use in public speaking, along with providing instruction in other subjects. In the play, Aristophanes satirizes sophists as teaching people to speak dishonestly, as seen when the character ______
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses a quotation from a translation of The Clouds to illustrate the claim?

options.name: A
options.content: Strepsiades encourages his son to learn to be a sophist, saying, "If you have any concern for your father's patrimony, become one of them."

options.name: B
options.content: Pheidippides says, after taking lessons from a sophist, "How pleasant it is to be acquainted with new and clever things, and to be able to despise the established laws!"

options.name: C
options.content: Strepsiades, taking lessons from a sophist, says he wants to become "a fabricator of falsehoods, inventive of words, a practiced knave in lawsuits.... a fox, a sharper, a slippery knave, a dissembler, a slippery fellow, an impostor."

options.name: D
options.content: Socrates, a sophist, says to a potential customer, "I wish to briefly learn from you if you are possessed of a good memory."

questions.correct: Strepsiades, taking lessons from a sophist, says he wants to become "a fabricator of falsehoods, inventive of words, a practiced knave in lawsuits.... a fox, a sharper, a slippery knave, a dissembler, a slippery fellow, an impostor."

questions.article: The musical Hadestown was produced off-Broadway in New York in 2016. A revised version of the musical premiered on Broadway in 2019, in a larger production. In a review of the Broadway production, theater critic Jesse Green enthusiastically praised the musical's storytelling. However, Green also explained that he had seen the earlier version of Hadestown in 2016 and had found the storytelling to be very confusing. This suggests that in Green's view, ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Hadestown improved greatly between 2016 and its premiere on Broadway.

options.name: B
options.content: the 2016 version of Hadestown had fewer storytelling problems than the 2019 version did.

options.name: C
options.content: Hadestown should have had a larger production in 2019 than it actually did.

options.name: D
options.content: the 2019 version of Hadestown was less enjoyable than the 2016 version.

questions.correct: Hadestown improved greatly between 2016 and its premiere on Broadway.

questions.article: Biochemists I. Sam Saguy and Eli J. Pinthus studied the mass and heat transfer processes that occur when foods, such as the Indian snacks makka poha and shankarpali, are fried in oil. During frying, water in the crust evaporates, leaving voids that oil can fill, thereby increasing the food's fat content. As the process continues, water from the food's center moves to the crust as long as the crust remains permeable. Therefore, the less moisture a food loses during frying, ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: the less the fat content is increased through frying.

options.name: B
options.content: the higher the temperature must be to fry the food.

options.name: C
options.content: the slower the crust will lose its permeability.

options.name: D
options.content: the crispier the crust will be when frying is completed.

questions.correct: the less the fat content is increased through frying.

questions.article: Water boils at around 212°F at sea level, but in Superior, Colorado (elevation: 5,495 feet above sea level), it boils at around 202°F. Food writer J. Kenji López-Alt, who explores the science behind cooking, ______ that lower boiling points at higher elevations "can wreak all sorts of havoc on recipes."
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: explain

options.name: B
options.content: explains

options.name: C
options.content: have explained

options.name: D
options.content: are explaining

questions.correct: explains

questions.article: Many Farms Chapter is one of the 110 chapters of the Navajo Nation (Naabeeho Bináhásdzo). The chapter, known as Dá'ák'eh Haláni in the Navajo language (Dine bizaad), was the subject of a profile ______ in the Navajo Times on August 22, 2013.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: appearing

options.name: B
options.content: has appeared

options.name: C
options.content: appeared

options.name: D
options.content: appears

questions.correct: appearing

questions.article: With the short documentary Rick Bartow: The Man Who Made Marks, Osage and Cherokee director Nanette Kelley joined the growing number of Indigenous women adding their voices to North American ______ film, a selection of the Native Women in Film Festival, is about the art of painter and musician Rick Bartow.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: cinema, her

options.name: B
options.content: cinema. Her

options.name: C
options.content: cinema and her

options.name: D
options.content: cinema her

questions.correct: cinema. Her

questions.article: Working with equipment designed for a billionths of a meter scale, ______
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: nanoengineers have synthesized silica nanoparticles that are used to administer medicines to specific cells in the body.

options.name: B
options.content: nanoengineers' synthesized silica nanoparticles are used to administer medicines to specific cells in the body.

options.name: C
options.content: silica nanoparticles that have been synthesized by nanoengineers are used to administer medicines to specific cells in the body.

options.name: D
options.content: synthesized silica nanoparticles used to administer medicines to specific cells in the body have been created by nanoengineers.

questions.correct: nanoengineers have synthesized silica nanoparticles that are used to administer medicines to specific cells in the body.

questions.article: Just as the Arrhenius equation in chemistry is named not after its first discoverer but after the physicist who further developed the equation, so too does the Cavendish balance in physics take its name from a ______ who was not the first to construct the device.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: natural philosopher: in this case, Henry Cavendish,

options.name: B
options.content: natural philosopher—in this case, Henry Cavendish,

options.name: C
options.content: natural philosopher in this case, Henry Cavendish,

options.name: D
options.content: natural philosopher—in this case, Henry Cavendish—

questions.correct: natural philosopher—in this case, Henry Cavendish—

questions.article: Jetties—long, narrow structures that extend from a landmass into the water—are often constructed to protect coastlines from erosion. Jetties can sometimes have the opposite ______ obstructing the natural flow of sand along the shore can lead to increased erosion in some areas.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: effect, though,

options.name: B
options.content: effect, though;

options.name: C
options.content: effect, though

options.name: D
options.content: effect; though

questions.correct: effect, though;

questions.article: The editors of Home Ground: A Guide to the American Landscape turned to Arturo Longoria, a nonfiction writer, to craft the entry for "arroyo," a term referring to the bed of an intermittently dry stream or creek. For "Iek," however, the editors chose the ______ author of The Very Rich Hours.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: poet, Emily Hiestand,

options.name: B
options.content: poet, Emily Hiestand

options.name: C
options.content: poet Emily Hiestand

options.name: D
options.content: poet Emily Hiestand,

questions.correct: poet Emily Hiestand,

questions.article: Guard cells are specialized cells that are part of a plant's pores. These cells help regulate the amount of carbon dioxide a plant takes in. ______ they help regulate a plant's water loss.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: In conclusion,

options.name: B
options.content: Additionally,

options.name: C
options.content: Instead,

options.name: D
options.content: Previously,

questions.correct: Additionally,

questions.article: Elara, one of the eighty known moons of Jupiter, is designated as Jupiter VII ("VII" means "7"). Roman numerals typically indicate the order in which the moons were named rather than the order of their proximity to Jupiter. It is incorrect to assume, ______ that Elara is the seventh moon from Jupiter in terms of proximity.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: however,

options.name: B
options.content: then,

options.name: C
options.content: moreover,

options.name: D
options.content: finally,

questions.correct: then,

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Dinosaur fossil specimens can be found at science museums all over the world.
  • A dinosaur fossil specimen nicknamed Stan is housed at the Black Hills Institute in Hill City, South Dakota.
  • Stan, a Tyrannosaurus, lived in the Late Cretaceous period.
  • A dinosaur fossil specimen nicknamed Horridus is housed at the Melbourne Museum in Melbourne, Australia.
  • Horridus, a Triceratops, lived in the Late Cretaceous period.
questions.question: The student wants to emphasize a similarity between the two dinosaur fossil specimens. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: Both the Tyrannosaurus fossil specimen Stan and the Triceratops fossil specimen Horridus lived in the Late Cretaceous period.

options.name: B
options.content: While the Tyrannosaurus fossil specimen Stan is in Hill City, South Dakota, the Triceratops fossil specimen Horridus is in Melbourne, Australia.

options.name: C
options.content: Dinosaur fossil specimens can be found at science museums all over the world, including in Hill City, South Dakota, and Melbourne, Australia.

options.name: D
options.content: The Black Hills Institute is home to Stan, a Tyrannosaurus fossil specimen from the Late Cretaceous period.

questions.correct: Both the Tyrannosaurus fossil specimen Stan and the Triceratops fossil specimen Horridus lived in the Late Cretaceous period.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Grimanesa Amoros is a Peruvian American artist well known for her LED light sculptures.
  • Her sculpture Uros House is made of smooth multicolored LED domes.
  • It occupies 250 cubic feet of space.
  • Her sculpture Ocupante is made of entangled blue and white LED tubes.
  • It occupies 80,000 cubic feet of space.
questions.question: The student wants to emphasize a similarity between Uros House and Ocupante. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: At 80,000 cubic feet in size, Grimanesa Amoros's Ocupante cuts a larger figure than the 250-cubic foot Uros House.

options.name: B
options.content: Uros House is an LED light sculpture made by Grimanesa Amoros, as is Ocupante.

options.name: C
options.content: The smooth LED domes of Grimanesa Amoros's Uros House stand in contrast to the tangled LED tubes of Ocupante.

options.name: D
options.content: Grimanesa Amoros is the artist behind Uros House, a sculpture made of smooth multicolored LED domes.

questions.correct: Uros House is an LED light sculpture made by Grimanesa Amoros, as is Ocupante.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Researchers in a 2021 study wanted to determine the rate at which 17 languages conveyed both information and syllables.
  • They calculated the bits of information conveyed per second (the IR, or information rate).
  • The IR was found to be approximately consistent across the 17 languages (an average of 39 bits per second).
  • They calculated the number of syllables spoken per second (the SR, or syllable rate).
  • Spanish had the second-fastest SR (7.7 syllables per second).
  • Vietnamese had the sixteenth-fastest SR (5.3 syllables per second).
questions.question: The student wants to present an overview of the study's findings. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: Though some of the languages differed in number of syllables spoken per second, all 17 conveyed information at roughly the same rate.

options.name: B
options.content: The 2021 study determined the information rate (IR) of 17 languages in bits of information conveyed per second.

options.name: C
options.content: Vietnamese had the sixteenth fastest syllable rate, lower than that of Spanish, which had the second fastest; however, Spanish had the lower information rate of the two.

options.name: D
options.content: Researchers found that information was conveyed more quickly in Spanish, at 7.7 syllables per second, than in Vietnamese, at 5.3 syllables per second.

questions.correct: Though some of the languages differed in number of syllables spoken per second, all 17 conveyed information at roughly the same rate.
